text:
Ms. [**Known lastname 5387**] is a 62 year-old woman with a history of hypertension and
   hyperlipidemia who initially presented to an OSH on [**3-18**] with
   pneumonia, now being transferred to [**Hospital1 5**] for further evaluation of
   hypoxia.
   Patient initially presented to her PCP [**Last Name (NamePattern4) **] [**3-16**] with cough and SOB; CXR
   at that time reportedly showed no infiltrate; antibiotics were started
   as an outpatient.  Then admitted to the OSH on [**3-18**] with cough and
   diarrhea and was found to have a LLL PNA.  Started on Levaquin IV.
   Blood cultures and legionella antigen were negative.  A few days into
   the hospitalization, IV steroids were started.  On [**3-24**] an ABG was
   obtained and showed 7.48/38/57.  A CT was done and showed bilateral
   infiltrates and no PE; zosyn was started.  An echo was also done and
   showed normal EF and mild pulmonary hypertension.  On [**3-30**], IV
   vancomycin was started.  Given concern for PCP, [**Name10 (NameIs) 5388**] was started
   on day of transfer.  Given persistent hypoxia, transfer to BIMDC was
   arranged.
          Cxr w/ bilat. Ground glass opacity.
          EKG done, non specific changes
          Abg 7.37/41/56 on non-invasive mask ventilation 100% Fio2,
   and PS 10. Plan for intubation for CT as Pt. w/ significant desats.
   With out O2, and does not tolerate laying flat.
          Lab:  wbc 17.1 today, up from 16.6, pending HIV test at
   transferring facility done 3.27
   Anxiety
   Assessment:
   Pt. with known hx of acute anxiety, clonipin and imiprimine for home
   regimen..  Arrives from osh with anxiety regarding sob . does respond
   to reassurance, sharing plan and reinforcing behavior
   Action:
   Much reassurance, share with pt [**Name (NI) 147**], describe activities, provide safe
   environment. PO regimen changed to PRN IV Lorazepam and Morphine.
   Response:
   Small effect noted with meds, and reassurance.
   Plan:
   Cont. plan as above.
   Pneumonia, bacterial, community acquired (CAP)
   Assessment:
   Pt received on hi-flow neb, 100% , desats with any activity, to high
   70
s visibly SOB with increase RR quickly.  LS rhonchurus/bronchial.
   Cxr done with bilateral ground glass opacities, using accessory muscles
   for breathing.  RR in 30-45
s awakes easily to noise or voice.  17.1.
   afebrile.
   Action:
   Non-invasive mask ventilation, following abg
s, likely plan for
   intubation.  Once resp. status stable plan for CT, and ? bronch. Nebs
   when appropriate.  Judicious use of IVF for hydration EF wnl.
   Response:
   Little response noted to wob.  Some improvement in abg
   Plan:
   Prob. Intubation at some point today. Further studies to fully
   understand causative [**Doctor Last Name **].  No aspiration noted recent swallow eval
   norm. , further labs and studies today.
